text: Beginning Tues, April 23, EB 7th Ave traffic will be closed btwn Univ Dr & 10th St N. WB traffic will not be affected. EB will be detoured south on Univ to 4th Ave N, then east to 10th St N back to 7th Ave N. The closure is for water & sewer termination & will be for 1 week.

Monday April 22, northbound traffic on South University Dr will be reduced to one lane between 30th and 27th Ave S. The east frontage road will be closed in this same stretch. The closure is necessary to facilitate a pipeline repair and is expected to be in place for one week.

Beginning Friday, April 19, 42nd St SB will be closed to thru traffic btwn 11th & 13th Ave S. SB vehicles will be detoured east on 9th Ave S then south on 38th St S to 13th Ave S. The closure is necessary to facilitate a pipeline repair, it is expected to be in place for one week
Construction on #MainAvenue started today! The roadway is currently closed between 2nd St and 4th St S. #FargoStreetspic.twitter.com/it1uoSk4RR

#MainAvenue construction starts TOMORROW! Main Avenue will be CLOSED to thru traffic between 2nd St and 4th St S. The posted detour route will be Northern Pacific (NP) Avenue between 8th St and 2nd St S. Visit http://FargoStreets.com for more information!pic.twitter.com/CxhsTFeYgj

Beginning Thursday, April 11, the southbound lane on Broadway between 12th and 13th Avenues North will be closed. The closure is needed for utility work on this block and is expected to be in place for one day. This work is weather dependent.

Do you have questions about the upcoming #MainAvenue projectGet them answered tomorrow! Join us from 4-6 p.m. at the Depot (701 Main Avenue) for a public information meeting. Formal presentations will be at 4:30 & 5:30 p.m. More info: http://bit.ly/MainPublicMeeting …

Southwest metro #FargoStreets motorists could potentially navigate through multiple work zones this year. Learn what projects you might encounter at http://www.southwestmetroworkzones.com . Motorists can get the big picture and plan driving routes in one spot.pic.twitter.com/pxvMafNWha

The 1st Avenue North Red River Bridge will be closed today at 1pm Thursday, April 4th to allow for City Crews to install the flood gates on the bridge due to rising flood waters. The 1st Avenue North Bridge will remain closed until the flood waters recede below the bridge.

The 12th Avenue North Red River Bridge will be closed today, Wednesday, April 3 at 6pm due to rising flood waters. The 12th Ave N Bridge will remain closed until the flood waters recede below the bridge.
Beginning Thursday, April 4, 2nd Avenue North will close between Broadway and Roberts Alley. The closure is needed for a crane and is expected to be in place until Thursday afternoon.

The North Broadway Red River Bridge will be closing due to rising flood waters. The closure will begin Tuesday, April 2 at 6:30 pm. Detour will be via County Road 20 Bridge. The North Broadway Bridge will remain closed until the flood waters recede below the bridge.

The 12th Ave N Red River Bridge will be closed from 10am to 4pm today, Tues, April 2 to remove fencing & street lights on the bridge due to rising flood waters.Find a complete list of road closures online at http://www.FargoStreets.com . Follow @FargoStreets on Facebook and Twitter

Tuesday, April 2, roadway removals move to the west side of Drain 27. Headed to #52ndAveS business district west of 45th St S? Business access is OPEN North side, Veterans Blvd to 51st Ave. South side, Veterans Blvd and 53rd Ave intersection. MORE: http://bit.ly/52ndAveS pic.twitter.com/xr0X30KPRM

Elm Street North will be closing between 13th and 15th Avenues North due to rising flood waters. The closure will begin Saturday, March 30 at 8:30am. Detour will be via 3rd Street North. Elm Street will remain closed until the flood waters recede below the roadway.

Monday, April 1, 3rd Ave N will close to through traffic between Broadway and 5th St N. Access to the alley on 3rd Ave N will be from Broadway only. The sidewalk on the north side of 3rd Ave N will remain open. The closure is expected to be in place until May 10.

Effective April 1, 2019 at 12:01 a.m., the City of Fargo will impose Class A & Class 1 load restrictions on various roads throughout town. Restrictions shall remain in effect until pavement subgrade conditions warrant removal, generally the first or middle part of May.

Thursday, March 28, the southbound lane on Broadway between 1 & 2 Ave N will be closed. The closure will be in place from 7am until 5pm on Thursday & Friday. The west side sidewalk and parking on the west side of Broadway will be closed adjacent to the Black building.

Beginning after morning rush hour on Wednesday, March 27, University Drive North will be reduced to one lane between 7th and 9th Avenues North. The closure is necessary for planned maintenance work by Xcel Energy. The closure is expected to be removed by the end of day.

Beginning tomorrow, March 26, westbound traffic on NP Ave will be reduced to one lane from the Red River to 2nd St N to repair a water main valve. The road is expected to be opened on Friday, March 29.

Starting tomorrow morning, March 22, 7th Ave N will be closed between 11th St & 9th St N to repair the road surface. Please follow posted detour signs. The road is expected to reopen by Mon., March 25.

Beginning on Monday, March 25, 2nd St S will close to through traffic between Main Ave and 4th Str S. The closure is expected to be in place by mid-Monday morning. The closure, expected to remain in place through the fall of 2019, is necessary to allow for a flood control project

12th Ave N has now been opened. Please continue to use caution when traveling. #FargoStreets

Due to blowing snow and a lack of visibility, 12th Avenue North will be closed from 45th Street North in Fargo to 9th Street in West Fargo beginning at 2 p.m. today. The road will reopen when conditions improve. #FargoStreets

The right lane of 10th St N is closed between 3rd & 6th Ave N. Closure is in place due to a failure in the road surface. Due to the current weather conditions & impending storm, this lane will remain closed until further notice. #FargoStreets

Public Works is asking drivers to refrain from on-street parking during the upcoming winter storm. On-street parking is discouraged from 10 p.m. tonight until 6 a.m. Saturday to ensure efficient snow removal operations. #FargoStreets

We have been in contact with Solid Waste. Please leave the can out there and they will come out to exchange it. If you don’t have one by tomorrow afternoon, please let us know.
Our supervisors were unaware this occurred, once they saw the video they knew where it was & they are now working to get this cleaned up. We are sorry for the inconvenience.

#FargoStreets Road Closure: 52nd Ave S Bridge at Drain 27. Thru-traffic diverted from 47th to 53rd Streets. All intersections and access points will remain open to east/west of closed road section. Use Veterans, Sheyenne St or 45th St S to 40th Ave S.

7th Ave N is closed again today from 10th to 11th St due to another water main break. Please follow posted detour signs. We hope to have the road open by the end of the day. #FargoStreets
7th Ave N is closed today from 10th to 11th St due to a water break. Please follow posted detour signs. The road will open by the end of the day. #FargoStreets

Beginning on Thursday, February 28, the southbound lane on Broadway between 3rd and 4th Avenues North will close. The closure is necessary to aid in the renovation of a nearby building and is expected to be in place from 5:30 am to 9:00 am.

Thank you for the report, this is currently on our list to widen when we are able. @Fargostreets is not continuously monitored by Street Dept staff. The Fargo One site or app is a great way to report issues. Thank you for your continued patience as we clean up #FargoStreets!

Public Input Meeting TOMORROW! City engineers will be at the FARGODOME in Room 203 from 5-7pm to answer your questions about the proposed improvements to North University Drive between 32nd Avenue North and 40th Avenue North. #FargoStreetspic.twitter.com/Ed1eejCaoJ

Contractors will be closing 52Ave S between 47St & 53St and detouring traffic to 40Ave S via 45St & Vets Blvd beg. March 1. The closure is necessary for the contractor to begin removing the existing bridge & start installing the new one. Add’l info at http://Fargostreets.com .

A public input meeting will be held from 5 to 7 p.m. on Tues, Feb 26 at the FARGODOME - Room 203, 1800 N Univy Dr. The public input meeting will utilize an open house format. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss proposed improvements to North University Drive.

Beginning on Friday, February 15, the southbound lane on Broadway between 3rd and 4th Avenues North will close from 8 a.m. to 11 a.m. The closure is necessary to aid in the renovation of a nearby building.

A public input meeting will be held from 5 to 7 p.m. on Tues, Feb 26 at the FARGODOME - Room 203, 1800 N Univ Dr, Fargo. The public input meeting will utilize an open house format. The purpose is to discuss proposed improvements to N Univ Dr btwn 32nd & 40th Ave N.
Beginning on Friday, February 15, the 4th Avenue North eastbound lane will be closed between 8am and 12 noon between 7th and 9th Streets North. The closure is necessary to allow for utility work.
19th Ave N is now open, thank you for your patience. #FargoStreets

Beginning Friday, February 1, 3rd Ave N will close between Broadway and 5th St N. The closure, which was delayed due to the cold weather conditions, is necessary for a crane associated with the Block 9 construction project. The closure will be in place for up to one week.

Beginning on Sunday, February 3, Broadway will close to through traffic between 2nd and 4th Avenues North. A crane is needed to lift materials onto the roof of a private building. The closure will begin Sunday morning and is expected to reopen early Sunday afternoon.
Public Works offices will be closed Wednesday, but 24 hour snow removal and sanding operations will continue.

Beginning Monday, January 28, 3rd Avenue North will close between Broadway and 5th Street North. The closure is for a crane for the Block 9 construction project. The closure will be in place for up to one week.

Beginning Monday, January 14, 6th Avenue North will be closed between Roberts Street and Broadway. The closure is for private utility work and is expected to be in place until Monday afternoon.

The City of Fargo will hold a public input meeting tonight at Bennett Elementary School-Multi-Purpose Rm, 2000 58th Ave S, on Thurs Jan 10 to discuss the details of the upcoming street project on 64 Ave S in 2020 & 2021. The meeting will 6:30-8:30pm, with a presentation at 7pm.

REMINDER: Public Input Meeting TONIGHT! City engineers will be at Bennett Elementary School from 6:30-8:30pm to answer your questions about the future 64th Avenue South reconstruction slated for the 2020 and 2021 construction seasons. Learn more here: http://bit.ly/2TC4SvB

Beginning Thursday, Dec 20, 5th Ave S will close between Univ Dr and 14th St S. The closure is necessary to allow an emergency private sewer to be repaired. Fifth Ave S is expected to reopen to westbound traffic by Friday morning. Eastbound will reopen on Friday evening.

Beginning Monday, December 3, 3rd Avenue North will close between Broadway and 5th Street N. The closure is necessary to allow for crane assembly for the Block 9 construction project. The closure will be in place for up to one week.

Beginning Thursday, November 29, the southbound lane on 4th Street South between 7th and 8th avenues south will be closed for the day. The closure is for the repair of a private sewer. Once crews are done working, the lane closure will be removed in the evening.
The southbound lane of 4th Street South between 7th and 8th avenues south is closed today for the repair of a private sewer. The lane will reopen this evening when the work is completed.

Tomorrow, Nov. 21, eastbound Main Ave will be closed between 14th St & 15th St, with traffic being head-to-head in the westbound lanes of Main Avenue. The closure is necessary to repair a water main break, and will fully reopen by the end of the day.

Good news! Work has wrapped up on #12thStreetNorth and the road is now OPEN! The reconstruction between NP Avenue and 1st Avenue North was necessary due to the deterioration of the existing street section, which was installed in 1951. #FargoStreetspic.twitter.com/bs5s6TNN0q

Beginning Wed, Oct 31, 38th St S will be closed to northbound through traffic between 9th and 4th Ave S. The closure will be in place at 9 a.m. and work is expected to take four hours. The closure is to allow crews to work on a private utility on the east shoulder of 38th St S.

Xcel Energy has begun construction on a new 115kV transmission line between the Red River and Maple River Substations. Beginning the week of Oct 29, 17th St N btwn 7th & 8th Ave N and Great Northern Dr btwn 8th Ave N & 25th St N will be impacted by Xcel Energy’s project.

Beginning Mon, Oct 29, Main Ave will be reduced to 1 lane eastbound btwn 2nd St & 8th St. There will also be a lane closure on northbound 4th St within the half block on each side of Main Ave. The closures are for locating utilities and is expected to be in place for one week.

Beginning Mon, Oct 29, there will be electrical utility work ongoing in the area of the 1st Ave N & Roberts St intersection as well as the 4 City blocks adjacent to this intersection. No detours are anticipated at this time. The project is expected to last two weeks.

Beginning Mon, Oct 29, eastbound 1st Ave N will be closed in the 1000-1100 block. Traffic will be detoured around this location via 12th St & NP Ave. The westbound lane will be open. The closure is for water service work & is expected to be in place for approximately 1 week.

Beginning Monday, the 12th Avenue/15th Avenue North Bridge will be closed to all vehicles and pedestrian traffic. Mill and overlay work will take place over a duration of 5 days, weather permitting.pic.twitter.com/APTo255iFD

Beginning Mon, Oct 22, Main Ave will be reduced to one lane eastbound between 10th St & Bdwy and one lane westbound between 9th St and 12th St. There will also be a lane closure on northbound 8th St within the half block on each side of Main Ave. This will be in place one week.

Beginning Fri, Oct 19, the southbound lane of Elm St at the 1200 block N will close until Sat, Oct 20 to allow for installation of a residential sewer service. Southbound Elm St will be detoured to Oak St via 13th Ave N. Northbound Elm St will not be detoured.

Beginning Monday, Oct. 22, the intersection of 55th St and 28th Ave South will close until November 5 to allow for installation of new curb/gutter, asphalt pavement and sidewalks in association with the City of Fargo’s Improvement District BN-18-L1. Detours will be in place.

Beginning Monday, October 15, northbound 45th Street will be reduced to one lane between 9th and 7th Avenues South. Crews will be working on private underground utilities and work is expected to take up to four days.

Beginning Monday, October 15, the south bound lane on Broadway will close between 3rd and 4th Avenues North. The closure is for a private underground utility connection. The south bound lane is expected to reopen by midday Thursday.

Beginning Tuesday, October 9th, NP Avenue will be closed to westbound traffic between 2nd and 3rd Streets North. The closure is for a crane that is needed to replace some private underground utilities. The closure is expected to be in place for up to four days.

Beginning Monday, October 8, northbound 45th Street will be reduced to one lane between 9th and 7th Avenues South. Crews will be working on private underground utilities and work is expected to take up to four days.

Beginning Monday, October 8, southbound University Drive South will be reduced to one lane by 40th Avenue South. The closure is for a City of Fargo flood control project and is expected to be in place for two weeks.
Paving on NP Ave from Roberts to Broadway is now complete. The road will completely open by 10:00 a.m. today. Thank you for your patience. #FargoStreets

Beginning Wednesday, October 3, 17th Avenue South will be closed to eastbound traffic between 32nd and 34th Streets South. Crews will be working on private underground utilities and work is expected to take up to four days.

Beginning Tuesday, October 2, Fifth Avenue North will be closed to through traffic between University Drive and 14th Street North. Crews will be installing private utilities. 5th Avenue is expected to be closed for four days.

If you are driving today, be sure to check car batteries and fuel levels before traveling. Use slower speeds, eliminate distractions and be on the watch for changes in a road’s surface that may affect traction, esp high traffic areas and bridge decks. Black ice is hiding! https://twitter.com/NWS/status/1090629186560102400 …

Black ice may be found on roadways with these very cold temps, especially in high traffic areas! Black ice forms when temps drop rapidly & any moisture on roads freezes into a smooth, nearly invisible, slippery surface. This thin layer of ice is very hard to detect pic.twitter.com/RsBQvRWaFy

Winter Weather Safety: Don't use cruise control in the snow, ice or even rain.
Don't tailgate, especially in the winter. It takes a longer distance to stop in snow or ice because your tires have reduced traction.
Even a four-wheel drive car, it's not safe to drive at high speeds during a snowstorm.
What do you have in your car winter survival kit? Pack a shovel, a working flashlight and batteries, a first aid kit and a blanket.
Winter Weather Safety: Did you know that if your car gets stuck, you shouldn't spin your wheels? This will dig you in deeper!
Do you know what to do if your rear wheels skid on ice? Tweet us and tell us what you think!

Safety Tip of the Day: You should increase your following distance by at least 3 times when driving in poor weather conditions.
Safety Tip of the Day: Change your wiper blades twice a year, or every 6,000 miles, to stay safe during heavy rains.
Safety Tip of the Day: If a tire pops, gradually release the accelerator, stabilize your car, & pull off the road. Do NOT hit the brake.
Safety Tip of the Day: Don’t drive the speed limit if the rest of the traffic is not. It is safer to drive with the speed of traffic.

Always wear your seat belt. Air bags do not work alone. A seat belt keeps you restrained in the exact spot the air bag protects you.
Safety Tip: Never try to out-run a train. The train's size and narrowing track makes the train appear to move slower than it really is.
Safety Tip of the Day: Practice courtesy while driving, but be sure you aren't obstructing traffic before letting someone in.
Safety Tip: Don't pass unless you're sure it's safe. The vehicle could be slowing down to avoid a hazard or let a pedestrian cross.

While fishtailing, let off brakes/gas & steer in direction u want to go ASAP. Counter-steer to stop turning until car is under control.
